channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Amazon giant plans chain of UK book shops and cashless convenience stores
item.description: The online retail giant has reportedly struck up a deal to open more than 10 Amazon Go stores across the country with the first expected to open in London this year and talks ongoing for 20 more.

item.title: Will Jeffrey Epstein's 'secret ex' lift the lid on the Prince Andrew sex abuse claims?
item.description: Shelley Anne Lewis, 43, was allegedly Jeffrey Epstein's girlfriend from 1999 to 2002. The relationship was at the time Prince Andrew allegedly slept with Virginia Roberts.

item.title: Ronnie O'Sullivan's estranged daughter hits out at him for never visiting his granddaughter
item.description: Taylor-Ann Magnus is snooker legend Ronnie O'Sullivan's daughter with Sally-Ann Magnus, who he had a year-long relationship with in the 1990s before his mother kicked Sally-Ann out.

item.title: Boy, 12, taken to hospital with Covid-19 symptoms is diagnosed with leukemia
item.description: Cody Lockey, of Darlington, County Durham, was taken to hospital on Monday when his mother Lisa suspected he had contracted Covid-19 - but the prognosis was much worse.

item.title: Pimlico Plummers tycoon Charlie Mullins FIRES staff who refused to return to work from furlough
item.description: Charlie Mullins said around 30 staff lost their jobs when Pimlico Plumbers ended its use of the furlough scheme on Friday. He said many on furlough 'are never going to get a job again'.

item.title: Housing Secretary Robert Jenrick insists bars will stay open
item.description: Robert Jenrick said that schools would definitely return to full capacity in September and confirmed it would be the priority should there be a rise infections.

item.title: South basks in 77F sunshine - but it's a washout for the North
item.description: The UK is set for a north-south divide as sunny spells and showers move across the nation, with temperatures in Scotland dropping to 66F and the South seeing highs of 77F.

item.title: Meghan Markle 'gifted Kate Middleton a Smythson notebook to break the ice when they met'
item.description: In Finding Freedom, which is released next week, authors Omid Scobie and Carolyn Durand say The Duchess of Cambridge loved the book from her future sister-in-law.

item.title: Revellers flock to Manchester's pubs and bars for a night on the tiles despite lockdown rules
item.description: Partygoers took advantage of hot weather this weekend to head out drinking in Manchester (pictured) and Blackpool.

item.title: Wife of 'Naughty Tory' MP Charlie Elphicke said she planned to leave him all along
item.description: Conservative MP wife of self-proclaimed 'naughty Tory' Charlie Elphicke had planned to leave her husband all along and only supported him during his trial because she thought he might kill himself.

item.title: Northern towns hit by new lockdown never got first wave of coronavirus under control, experts warn
item.description: Data, published by Public Health England, suggests the average rate of infections across the affected areas in northern England has been much higher than the rest of England.

item.title: Ministers warn hairdressers could pass on coronavirus to clients because of their inadequate visors
item.description: Scientists have raised concerns that the plastic face visors worn by barbers and hairdressers might not be providing suitable protection for against coronavirus for the staff or clients.

item.title: MAIL ON SUNDAY COMMENT: Get Britain back to work, Boris - and start with the schools
item.description: To our bold and thoughtful Prime Minister, we would like to address this very simple idea. Unless we can revive and restore the economy, our ability to conquer the Covid menace will shrink and fade...

item.title: Who are secretive British protest group Forever Family?
item.description: Forever Family - whose social media accounts are mostly set to private - aims to centralise community groups in a bid to support like-minded organisations.

item.title: Student slams dangerous so-called 'smart' motorways after horror crash on M1 killed his friend
item.description: Mohammed Bhaimia, 20, was in a broken down car with four other people when an HGV ploughed into the back of them on a stretch of smart motorway on the M1 near Dunstable, Bedfordshire.

item.title: Professor Robert Dingwall calls for a 'sense of proportion' and brands Covid-19 a 'nasty infection'
item.description: Writing a column in the Daily Express, Robert Dingwall, professor of sociology at Nottingham Trent University, says there needs to be a 'sense of proportion' over coronavirus.

item.title: Prince William correctly predicted the FA Cup final score
item.description: The Duke of Cambridge, 38, joined guests on blue and white striped deckchairs to watch the game on a big screen at the Sandrinham Estate in Norfolk, where he is spending lockdown.

item.title: MANZOOR MOGHAL: I've lost count of the times I've spoken to my community about Covid
item.description: For those paying attention to the South Asian community response to Covid, new restrictions will be no surprise, Chairman of Leicester's Muslim Forum MANZOOR MOGHAL says.

item.title: John Cleese says children hardly recognise him
item.description: John Cleese, 80, told fans at an online question and answer forum that Americans have a greater enthusiasm now for Monty Python's Flying Circus than people in Britain.

item.title: Over 50s could face stay at home order in 'nuclear plans' drawn up by Boris Johnson
item.description: The Prime Minister held a 'war game' session with Chancellor Rishi Sunak on Wednesday to run through possible options for averting another nationwide lockdown.

item.title: James Middleton shares a sneak peek of his parents' rustic family kitchen
item.description: In an Instagram video for pet supplies company Ella & Co posted yesterday, the 33-year-old entrepreneur discusses the health benefits of apples for dogs (and humans) from their rustic kitchen.

item.title: Coleen and Wayne Rooney put on a rare cheery display in Barbados amid WAG war
item.description: The WAG and the Derby County captain, both 34, put on a rare cheery display as they enjoyed a boat trip during their Barbados holiday with their four sons on Friday.

item.title: Coventry father-of-three, 38, gives the inside of his Vauxhall van makeover for just £68
item.description: Wayne Mulholland, 38, a father-of-three and diamond driller from Coventry, wanted to give his 2009 Vauxhall Vivaro a makeover but was keen to stick to a tight budget.

item.title: Mother transforms her utility floor for less than £50 using a stylish homemade cardboard stencil
item.description: Nicola Hill, 48, a civil servant from Stoke-on-Trent, made an amazing geometric floor pattern using a homemade stencil and Frenchic paint, and the project cost less than £50.

item.title: Teaching unions sound alarm AGAIN over plans to reopen schools
item.description: The Government imposed new restrictions on the north of England on Thursday and on Friday it pumped the brakes on reopening bowling alleys, casinos, skating rinks and other venues.

item.title: TV Licensing website crashes on first day of new charge for over-75s
item.description: BBC's decision to scrap free licences for over-75s means more than three million households are being asked to pay the £157.50 annual fee for the first time.

item.title: Manchester United legend Paul Scholes flouts lockdown rules for his son's birthday bash
item.description: Paul Scholes threw a huge birthday party for his son Arron's 21st birthday at his £3.5million Oldham home this week, despite coronavirus lockdown rules being imposed across the North West.

item.title: Ministers abandon key pledge to test all care home residents for Covid regularly throughout summer
item.description: Government officials had promised to regularly test up to two million UK care home residents and staff in a bid to keep track of the virus. But the timeline will now be pushed back until September.

item.title: Where to find your perfect examples of the UK's finest food - from hotpot to tarts and oysters
item.description: Here the Mail on Sunday's Richard Mellor takes you on regional food tour around the UK and picks up the best places to enjoy the nation's most renowned dishes.

item.title: Footage shows police violently dragging a grieving father from his dying six-year-old daughter
item.description: The film from a police body camera shows the moment Rashid Abbasi, a 59-year-old hospital consultant, was wrenched away from his critically ill six-year-old daughter by an officer holding his neck.

item.title: TV's Cleo Rocos: I'd get £10,000 just to turn up with Kenny Everett
item.description: Cleo Rocos, who famously starred alongside Kenny Everett in the Kenny Everett TV show in the 1980s, also reveals she had to go on Celebrity Big Brother in order to pay an unexpectedly large tax bill.

item.title: Christian Brueckner 'boasted about performing sex act naked in front of sleeping British girls'
item.description: Christian Brueckner reportedly told a close friend he stripped down naked before breaking into the holiday home in Portugal. He reportedly fled when one teen woke up terrified.

item.title: Florida man is filmed clinging to the hood of a semi truck driving down an interstate for NINE MILES
item.description: According to the Florida Highway Patrol, dispatchers were told that a white male was driving a Toyota SUV with a male passenger traveling southbound on Florida Turnpike.

item.title: Bari Weiss calls cancel culture 'social murder' and said 'it isn't about criticism but punishment'
item.description: Bari Weiss (left), who quit The New York Times in June after she claimed she was bullied by other staff members for her views, told Bill Maher (right) on Friday that 'cancel culture' was akin to 'social murder.'

item.title: Prince William enjoys a nostalgic family break to island where he holidayed with Charles and Diana
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge enjoyed a week-long staycation on tiny Tresco, in the Isles of Scilly, staying at Dolphin House, a beautiful six-bedroom property owned by Prince Charles.

item.title: First-time buyers face rising mortgage costs as HSBC and TSB up high LTV rates
item.description: A range of lenders increased their rates on high loan-to-value mortgages last week, even though the Bank of England interest rate has remained rock bottom at 0.1 per cent.

item.title: Robert Jenrick reveals plans to slash red tape and hand automatic approval to hospitals and schools
item.description: A 'once-in-a-generation' reform will give automatic planning approval to new homes built on land earmarked for 'growth'. The new planning system will divide the country into three types of land.

item.title: Nationwide cracks down on mortgage borrowers relying on parents for deposit
item.description: Nationwide, the UK's second-biggest mortgage lender, will restrict the contributions made by the so-called Bank of Mum and Dad and ask buyers to prove they have set aside their own savings.

item.title: Hundreds of protesters aiming to 'lock down' Brixton march down London streets
item.description: Groups marched through Brixton in a bid to make themselves heard by the UK government despite police issuing restrictions prior to the planned even this afternoon.

item.title: Secondary school maths teacher appalled by intransigence of her union to get children back to school
item.description: Appalled by the intransigence of her union over getting pupils back into classrooms, this maths teacher at a state secondary in the North of England resigned her membership.

item.title: 'Rogue SAS Afghanistan execution squad' carried out a series of night-time killings in Afghanistan
item.description: The trove of secret files was previously withheld from an ongoing High Court legal case by the government, causing a judge to demand an explanation from defence secretary Ben Wallace.

item.title: Mother reveals why you should always store ice cream tubs upside down
item.description: An Australian mother has revealed why she always stores her ice cream tubs upside down in the freezer.

item.title: Why did EDF Energy install a smart meter 9ft high where I couldn't reach it?
item.description: When Joy Thomas was told she needed her energy meter replaced five years ago with a 'smart' one, her supplier said she'd be able to save money by seeing live data of her power usage.

item.title: Bride asks guests, including her own family, to write 250-word essay to get an invite to her wedding
item.description: A bride-to-be has left her sister shocked and upset with her 'insane' demand after asking guests to formally submit a 500-word essay on why they wish to attend.

item.title: James Murdoch steps down after he and his wife grew disillusioned with company's coverage
item.description: James Murdoch, 47, who was once seen as the favourite to take over News Corporation, cited editorial disagreements in his bombshell resignation letter. But he is thought to have grown disillusioned.

item.title: Fans went wild for football memorabilia during the coronavirus lockdown
item.description: Interest in old programmes, shirts and other memorabilia was fuelled during lockdown when no football was played. With stadiums still shut, the trend shows no sign of abating.

item.title: Thomas Markle 'given up on Meghan and Harry' after reading Finding Freedom, says son Thomas Jnr.
item.description: Meghan Markle's father Thomas (pictured) has given up on a reunion with his daughter and Prince Harry, as he 'doesn't trust her', his son Thomas Markle Jnr has claimed.

item.title: How FBI tracked down the celebrity Twitter hackers: Cyber criminals were 'extremely sloppy'
item.description: Graham Ivan Clark, 17, Nima Fazeli, 22, and Mason Sheppard, 19, have all be charged in relation to the hack, which took place on July 15.

item.title: Lady Colin Campbell compares Meghan Markle to Lady Macbeth
item.description: Lady Colin, who knew Prince Harry's mother, Princess Diana, warned the Duke of Sussex about the way his wife has acted and how he is now more distant from his family.

item.title: Antibody coronavirus tests fail to work for large number of people
item.description: A study of more than 9,000 UK healthcare workers found that significant numbers had received negative test results despite being likely to have already contracted Covid-19.

item.title: ANDREW ROBERTS: Dissenters live in fear and serious debate is silenced by the woke mob
item.description: It gets more ludicrous with every passing day - and more sinister. Take the case of Professor Patricia Simon, from Marymount Manhattan College in New York, who made the mistake of failing to be...

item.title: Britain suffers 771 more Covid-19 cases amid warnings the infection rate could be at 'tipping point'
item.description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Great Britain, as of 9am today, stands at 303,952.

item.title: Dog selfies, a cat on the toilet and horses headbutting are among Comedy Pet Photo Awards entries
item.description: The adorable shots, which including smiling pooches and dancing cats, have been entered by pet owners across the UK, who hope to win the £3000 prize and be crowned pet photographer of the year.

item.title: Pub bosses warn ministers that shutting bars again 'will destroy jobs'
item.description: Professor Graham Medley, a member of the Scientific Advisory Group for Emergencies, said most people would prioritise 'the health and wellbeing of children' over going to the pub.

item.title: Woman, 57, who underwent the first face transplant in the U.S. dies from an infection
item.description: Connie Culp, the first US recipient of a partial face transplant, has died at age 57 from an infection unrelated to the surgery, according to Ohio's Cleveland Clinic.

item.title: More people are dying from bowel cancer than coronavirus
item.description: Professor Karol Sikora, an oncologist, said cancer deaths would start to climb if Ministers did not start focusing on non-coronavirus patients, who have found it harder to get vital tests.

item.title: Family tragedy of the Bognor Regis teenager charged over Twitter hack
item.description: Mason Sheppard, 19, who was charged with hacking Twitter and stealing thousands of dollars worth of Bitcoin was yesterday described as 'a nice lad' whose father passed away around five years ago.

item.title: Suspects have the right to keep their nationality a secret
item.description: The new regime has been forced on Ministers by top judges, prosecutors and police chiefs who decided that collecting the nationalities of every suspect breached privacy laws.

item.title: Lobbying firm with close links to Beijing gained access to influential UK figures
item.description: Hampton Group, which has its HQ near St Paul's Cathedral in Central London, was founded by a former Chinese government official.

item.title: Queen scolded Prince Harry for using bad language towards her closest aide
item.description: The Queen gave Prince Harry a dressing down for using offensive language about her closest aide, The Mail on Sunday can reveal.

item.title: Black Lives Matter UK to announce how it will spend £1million of crowdfunded donations
item.description: A GoFundMe crowdfunding campaign started by the activist group on June 2 has attracted more than 35,000 donations totalling £1.17 million.

item.title: Campaigners demand Rhodes primary school in North London change its name
item.description: Historians believe that Rhodes Avenue Primary in North London was named after wealthy landowner Thomas Rhodes, who died when his great nephew Cecil was just three years old.

item.title: Senior Tory MP is arrested on suspicion of rape
item.description: A leading Tory MP was last night arrested on suspicion of raping and sexually assaulting a Commons researcher in the latest abuse scandal to hit the Government.

item.title: Virginia Roberts 'spent two days alone with Prince Andrew at Epstein's New Mexico ranch'
item.description: Virginia Roberts recalled the alleged encounter in a 139-page manuscript titled, 'The Billionaire's Playboy Club,' in which she documents being sex trafficked by Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

item.title: TV SAS star Ant Middleton is given the boot from Soccer Aid
item.description: It comes after Royal Navy bosses planned to sack the SAS: Who Dares Wins instructor from their cadet corps because he shared criticisms of rioting Black Lives Matter protesters on social media.

item.title: Revolution sweeping newsrooms sees journalists who deviate from liberal orthodoxy hounded out
item.description: The death of free speech in America has seen journalists who deviate from a new liberal orthodoxy hounded out by their peers and the public...

item.title: Lindsey Graham says Microsoft should take over TikTok's U.S. operations
item.description: Lindsey Graham tweeted his support of Trump taking action against the popular video-sharing app, which officials claim poses a national security risk because of the personal data it handles.

item.title: New BBC drama about London's 18th Century sex trade is inspired by Covent Garden courtesans
item.description: Harlots, a BBC2 drama series starting next week, lifts the lid on the sex trade of the Georgian era. It begins with a flurry of excitement over the publication of a guide to the capital's sex workers.

item.title: Adele shows off her seven stone weight loss as she supports pal Beyonce's visual album Black Is King
item.description: The Rolling In The Deep songstress, 32, showed off her seven stone weight loss as she posed for a snap on Saturday, as she watched the singer, 38, perform in her Already music video.

item.title: Police battle to shut down illegal rave in the Forest of Dean
item.description: Officers say it will likely take 'some time' to disperse the unlicensed party, which took place in the Forest of Dean, in Gloucestershire, last night.

item.title: Virginia Roberts takes a dig at Ghislaine Maxwell in scathing tweet
item.description: Virginia Roberts Giuffre had some harsh words for her alleged abuser Ghislaine Maxwell on Twitter on Saturday after the British socialite tried to block the release of a 2016 civil case deposition,

item.title: Donald Trump says there is 'too much income disparity' in the US as he shares video of Jeff Bezos
item.description: Trump on Saturday said 'changes must be made soon', after tweeting a Business Insider video showing how the country's richest tech execs have only grown richer during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Wilford Brimley, actor who appeared in Cocoon before becoming Quaker Oats pitch man, dies at 85
item.description: Wilford Brimley, the character actor who appeared in such hit films as Cocoon and The Firm but is best known as the pitch man for Quaker Oats food products, has died. He was 85.

item.title: Victoria hit with over 650 new coronavirus cases and a record 17 deaths
item.description: Today is the deadliest day of the coronavirus pandemic in Victoria with 17 people losing their battle for life and hundreds more infected.

item.title: Astronauts successfully depart ISS aboard SpaceX Dragon to head home before splashdown Sunday
item.description: Two Nasa astronauts will make the first splashdown return in 45 years after SpaceX's astronaut carrier the Crew Dragon successfully undocked from the International Space Station.

item.title: Barack Obama's Kenyan half-brother Malik rips his sibling as cold and ruthless
item.description: Malik, 62, spoke to the New York Post via Skype from his home in the Kenyan village of Nyang'oma Kogelo for an interview published on Saturday to promote his new book.

item.title: Four weddings, four funerals & the world's wealthiest widow
item.description: She outlived four husbands, spent their enormous fortunes - and earned the nickname Lady Killmore. We reveal the secrets of Enid Lindeman, one of history's most scandalous socialites

item.title: Cate Blanchett's English manor has a chilling past of drugs, witchcraft and looters
item.description: Cate Blanchett and her husband Andrew Upton splashed a cool $6.25million on a lavish English manor named Highwell House in 2016.

item.title: The Chase star Mark Labbett reveals he had suspected coronavirus and has lost almost five-stone
item.description: Although he never got a test for the virus, Mark Labbett, 54, explained that he hardly ate for two weeks and suffered 'uncontrollable spells' of fevers.

item.title: SEAN RAYMENT recalls that his jovial Chinese friend was a ruthless SPY
item.description: We always met in a Chinese restaurant and we laughed a lot. Mainly silly things due to misunderstandings caused by language. His English was poor but somehow we muddled along.

item.title: How a dashing Luftwaffe officer and his bohemian wife hatched a plot by to defeat Hitler
item.description: The two young people are in love, healthy, wealthy and 'Aryan' through and through. Both are from highly respectable German families, so what about them could possibly arouse suspicions?

item.title: Customer numbers fall after compulsory face masks were introduced in shops, figures reveal
item.description: Footfall dropped by 1.6 per cent in England since face masks were made compulsory in shops on Friday last week. The steepest downturn was in retail parks where it dropped by 6.6 per cent.

item.title: China's 300-mile fishing fleet is decimating endangered species, scientists warn
item.description: Stretching for miles across the horizon, a vast armada of Chinese fishing boats trawl the pristine waters close to the Galapagos Islands

item.title: Kate Rothschild's dilemma over her ex-boyfriend Jay Electronica calling rabbi a 'coward' and 'devil'
item.description: TALK OF THE TOWN: Kate, 38, has been conspicuous in her silence over the comments. Jay Electronica is signed to Jay-Z's record label, where she holds a senior management position.

item.title: Carrie Symonds stopped fiancé Boris Johnson ditching transgender reforms, MPs claim
item.description: Boris Johnson developed cold feet about scrapping reforms that would make it easier for people to change their legal gender after being influenced by Carrie Symonds, Tory MPs have claimed.

item.title: The simple tweaks that can prevent dementia (plus delicious recipes to help beat it)
item.description: Although incurable, a staggering 40 per cent of cases could be prevented in the first place, according to a global report revealed at the Alzheimer's Association International Congress last week.

item.title: Wife recalls how husband was hospitalised after being denied a face-to-face GP appointment
item.description: Since March, most GP surgeries have radically cut down on face-to-face consultations in a bid to reduce coronavirus spreading. Doctors phone patients instead, often from their own homes.

item.title: ALEXANDRA SHULMAN'S NOTEBOOK: Seven suitcases Coleen? That's travelling light!
item.description: ALEXANDRA SHULMAN'S NOTEBOOK: The Rooney family arrived for their Barbados holiday with shedloads of luggage. Seven vast hard-shell suitcases. Yes. I counted.

item.title: PETER HITCHENS: The Government'National Panic Service is being used to keep us in perpetual alarm
item.description: PETER HITCHENS: The truth is that the number of deaths from Covid, even the fiddled and inflated version which the Government clings to, is falling closer and closer to zero.

item.title: Senior civil servant's £500,000 retirement pay-off sets new Whitehall record
item.description: Former Defra boss Clare Moriarty landed a redundancy payment of more than £300,000 on top of her £180,000 salary - and pocketed a bonus of close to £20,000 for good measure.

item.title: Who killed Jimi Hendrix? Fifty years after musician's death PHILIP NORMAN tells the definitive story
item.description: PHILIP NORMAN: Arguably the greatest instrumentalist in the history of rock music. So says a citation in the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in Cleveland, Ohio.

item.title: DAN HODGES: This is no time for a midlife crisis Boris!
item.description: DAN HODGES: Some people in Government have suggested his sudden grasping at the apron strings of the Nanny State actually represents the re-emergence of 'the real Boris'.

item.title: National Audubon Society speaks out against namesake for slave-owning and white supremacist past
item.description: An often glossed-over part of John James Audubon's history is that he owned many slaves, sold them to others and saw black and indigenous people as being inferior to white people.

item.title: Dame Barbara Windsor is 'comfortable and happy' after being moved into a nursing home
item.description: The actor, 71, has been in contact with the 82-year-old EastEnders star's husband Scott Mitchell, who admitted on Friday he was 'heartbroken' by the move.

item.title: Bob Willis's widow reveals her haunting regret the late cricketer's cancer was not spotted sooner
item.description: Bob Willis, 71, died last December from prostate cancer. His wife Lauren Clark, 52, has given her first interview since his death. Willis was one of the stars of England's 1981 Ashes series.

item.title: Russia prepares for mass coronavirus vaccination campaign in October
item.description: A state research facility in Moscow, the Gamaleya Institute, completed clinical trials of the vaccine and is working on getting it registered. Health Minister Mikhail Murashko plans to roll it out in October.

item.title: Donald Trump says Dr. Fauci is WRONG for saying that the U.S. is seeing a sharp rise in COVID-19
item.description: President Donald Trump finished golfing to declare that Dr. Fauci was 'wrong' to say that the country was seeing a rise in coronavirus cases.

item.title: NHS worker reveals stern conversations with a businessman who refused to leave the office
item.description: A TEST AND TRACE WORKER: After innumerable phone calls, I had finally traced my middle-aged businessman, but rather than finding him self-isolating at home he was at work

item.title: Fury as ex-Brexit Party MEP who 'defended' the IRA is awarded a peerage
item.description: There was also anger that the new batch of Labour peers includes an academic who retweeted claims that the 'Jewish establishment' had 'taken out a contract' on Jeremy Corbyn.

item.title: Met Police destroyed records of Prince Andrew's Pizza Express alibi
item.description: Virginia Roberts, then 17, claims she was coerced by paedophile Jeffrey Epstein into having sex with the Prince on the night of March 10 at the Belgravia home of Ghislaine Maxwell.

item.title: Pioneering treatment for dementia could be available in the UK in two years
item.description: Projects are under way that could result in new medications for people with the degenerative disease (pictured: Aldo Ceresa, whose symptoms eased during a trial, with his wife Laura).

item.title: Tom Cruise throws himself out of helicopter from 10,000ft
item.description: Tom Cruise, who famously likes to perform his own stunts, last week threw himself out of a helicopter 10,000ft over the over the Oxfordshire countryside for the latest movie in the franchise.

item.title: Sean Penn, 59, 'marries Greta Scacchi's daughter Leila George, 28, in secret ceremony'
item.description: The Milk actor, 59, has tied the knot with his 28-year-old bride in a secret ceremony, Irena Medavoy - the wife of Black Swan producer Mike - has revealed.

item.title: Schoolboy sobs as Jet2 cuts family's dream holiday in Spain short
item.description: The Mason family were just four days into their two-week holiday on the Spanish island of Menorca when providers Jet2 emailed them to say they had to cut their trip short.

item.title: Take out meal! Clever bear is spotted wheeling trash can along driveway before tucking into scraps
item.description: A black bear was spotted pulling a wheeled trash can away from the street at a home in Florida. A surveillance camera caught the bear standing on its hind legs and dragging the trash can.

item.title: The land with no face masks: Holland's top scientists say there's no solid evidence coverings work
item.description: While 120 countries in the world, including much of Europe, have ordered citizens to wear masks in public places to prevent the spread of Covid-19, the Dutch are doing things differently.

item.title: Don't buy into the superfood hype... but eating right CAN reduce your risk of dementia
item.description: Studies have found the rates of dementia in participants who ate the Mediterranean diet are up to 40 per cent lower than those who do not, writes nutritionist ANGELA DOWDEN.

item.title: Beat type 2 diabetes in middle age - and you could fight off Alzheimer's
item.description: One study of people with Alzheimer's found 81 per cent had either diabetes or raised blood sugar levels, known as prediabetes, which puts them on the cusp of developing the full-blown condition.

item.title: Want to slash your risk of dementia by a third? Sort out your hearing!
item.description: Astonishingly, hearing loss in mid-life raises the risk of dementia later on by up to 40 per cent, according to some studies. That makes it the leading preventable cause of dementia, experts say.

item.title: DR ELLIE CANNON: Dementia ISN'T just part of old age - nearly HALF of cases can be avoided
item.description: DR ELLIE CANNON: Dementia is the most feared condition among people over 50, according to surveys. Yet most people assume there's little they can do to protect themselves.

item.title: Liz Truss is warned she faces Tory rebellion unless she guarantees protection for British farmers
item.description: Liz Truss was warned to expect a fresh revolt from Tory MPs unless she guaranteed 'in law' not to sell out the UK's world-class food production standards in a trade deal with the US.

item.title: DEBORAH ROSS: Goodness gracious me: why the Peter Sellers accents?
item.description: A Suitable Boy is the BBC's much-anticipated adaptation of Vikram Seth's 1,349-page, 592,552-word novel, which is one of those big books I always said I'd read but never have

item.title: Great British Boltholes: A review of Mason's Arms, Devon
item.description: The Daily Mail's Simon Heptinstall checked into Mason's Arms, a 28-room luxury pub-cum-hotel located in the village of Branscombe. He liked the homely touches and its proximity to the beach.

item.title: Let a city break save your summer, from Bologna to Berlin
item.description: If you've been put off by the new quarantine rules suddenly slapped on holidaymakers in Spain, your saviour could be long weekends in some of Europe's most amazing cities.

item.title: Saddle up for a Norfolk ride... to discover Black Beauty and author Anna Sewell's birthplace
item.description: We explore the location of Black Beauty and discover more about its author, Anna Sewell - plus find fabulous places to eat, drink and stay.

item.title: 'I've considered all the risks,' Joan chuckled. 'If you die, Piers, you die'
item.description: Dame Joan Collins has been enraged about the way older people have been treated during the coronavirus crisis

item.title: Chaos at Heathrow as hundreds of travellers are forced to pack into huge queues
item.description: Hundreds of passengers chanted 'we want more staff' as they were crammed into queues at the UK border in Heathrow Terminal 5's arrivals area today.

item.title: Usain Bolt shares sweet video talking to his baby daughter Olympia Lightning
item.description: The eight-time Olympic gold medallist, 33, looked happier than ever as he cooed to his baby daughter.

item.title: 'It's happening!' Idris Elba CONFIRMS his hit BBC series Luther will be made into a movie
item.description: The actor, 47, confirmed on Friday that his hit BBC series Luther will be made into a movie as he teased 'the sky is the limit' for the feature-length version.

item.title: Councils in infection hotspots launch action plans in bid to stop surge in COVID cases
item.description: Six places were yesterday revealed as being on the government's coronavirus 'watch-list', but have yet to have any new measures imposed to tackle outbreaks.

item.title: Thirsty Plant Baby Adam Lin transforms his home into a tropical jungle with more than 300 plants
item.description: Adam Lin, from Melbourne, now owns more than 300 plants worth over $50,000 and says his love for indoor gardening blossomed in 2016.

item.title: Traffic police officers help deliver baby after driver's wife went into labour
item.description: The baby's father was captured by a camera in Northampton. He told PCs Sandra Payne and James Condon he had just insured his car that morning. Then his wife called.

item.title: Former British army officer is facing 13 years in jail
item.description: Thomas Lishman, 58, was detained by Romanian authorities on December 15 after the event at a retreat outside the capital Bucharest where he served people with ayahuasca, file photo.
